title: Sync my PC
content: I have a shiny new PC, and when I installed firefox I assumed it would return my favourites, extensins etc but so far it hasnt. Is there a way to force it
creator: ningaginger666

title: Firefox 108.0.2 64-bit on Windows 10 Pro 64-bit (1809) download history disappears on every new session
content: Some pernicious change occurred with the latest version of Firefox because now I have to do an extra click and go through the library to then open my downloads folder. I don't like the separate library window...it's not convenient and it's more work to use than it's worth. I used to be able get to the downloads folder directly by clicking on the down arrow in my extension tool bar which showed all recent downloads (even after rebooting) and then access to the download folder was right next to any of the recent downloads. Worked great that way. It used to be a quick way to get to the downloads folder and now I have to download a file before I can use that method, but then it disappears again if I close Firefox. How do I get that back permanently. I don't want that list to disappear each time I exit and restart Firefox. I already tried "privacy.clearOnShutdown.downloads" and that has no effect. What would be the correct setting in about:configÂ ? Steve
creator: ssybesma

title: Bookmarks missing icon
content:
Some of my bookmarks have only the generic "globe" icon even I can see the icon on the "tab" when I open the webpage. I also tried:

  • to remove the bookmark and add it back
  • to install some add-ins to customize the icon
  • to clear cache
  • to use different computer

One of the examples with missing icon in bookmarks is "https://app.powerbi.com/home". When i tried different browser (Edge, Chrome), it worked there.
creator: lukas.heinz

title: Amazon music and amazon prime video do not work on firefox
content: Firefox 108.0.2 (64 bit),Win11PRO. When I start a stream on amazon music or primevideo the plugin WidevineCdm crashes and a generic error is shown on the screen. I test with a new, empty profile, but the error still occurs. By inspecting the developer console, many CSP error are shown, but I'm not sure if they're related to the issue. Suggestions?
creator: bunglegrind

title: Who is managing my Browser?
content: In my 'Settings' it says: "Your browser is being managed by your organization." What??? What organization? How can I find out who this is? and how can I get rid of this 'managing organization'? I want to clear this statement from my account.
creator: h_spencer_oneal

title: Can Mac native "Look up words" function be enabled?
content:
Back when I used Chrome, there used to be an option when you could right-click a word and get an option in the context menu to "look up". In Firefox this doesn't seem to be the case. Is there a way to enable this? For those of you who don't know what feature I'm talking about, here's Apple's write up: https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/look-up-words-mchl3983326c/10.14/mac/10.14

I've also included screenshots of the feature working in Chrome.
creator: christineleonard195+mozilla

title: How do I get rid of this?

title: Bookmark recovery after a new windows install
content: I recently installed windows on a new solid state hard drive, and did a fresh install of firefox, but I forgot to manually backup my bookmarks. The old install is still on the old windows hard drive, is there a way for me to move them onto the new install? I'd prefer to not have to rebuild the whole list from scratch!
creator: januskrug

title: Customization
content:

if there is any way to do this, please tell me

also, how do you make your bookmarks show while in a site?

thanks guys!
creator: snapfloresco

title: Browser history recovery
content:
As of recent I've been having troubles with my Firefox browser. Out of nowhere it has started relentlessly purging my browser history to the point where nothing lasts more than a week now before getting deleted, and it is only getting worse. Prior to this Firefox would save data from over a year and simply just remove the oldest data in order to make room for the newest whenever necessary. That is no longer the case now.

I'm fairly certain that I haven't done anything to cause Firefox to do this, but I can't be sure. Looked in the settings and can't see anything that would cause this.

So my questions are: 1.) Can the history deleted be recovered? and 2.) Is it possible to get Firefox to stop purging my history on it's own so frequently?

Any and all help is appreciated.
creator: georgekalimeris02

title: bookmarks are gone
content: i just signed into mozilla and all my bookmarks are missing. i would like to recover my bookmarks.
